intro: Maytenus huberi, commonly known as the Mexican mulberry, is a small evergreen tree native to Mexico and Central America. It belongs to the family Celastaceae and is characterized by its smooth, grayish-brown bark and opposite, elliptical leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in axillary inflorescences, followed by red, fleshy berries that are edible for birds and other wildlife. Maytenus huberi is often found in moist, well-drained soils in tropical and subtropical regions.
